description.value:
There is a subtle craft to what a Rogue does, and many simply see someone who lurks in the shadows and waits for an opportunity to stab someone in the back or rob them blind.  But a Rogue is so much more.  Rogues are resourceful, highly skilled individuals that know the value of staying out of sight and a well placed blade.
    Rogues come in many different varieties as well.  Some are artists with words and match that with their knowledge of people to talk their ways through anything.  Others are masters of locks and traps, knowing all of their ins and outs.  While still others are silent stalkers that are never seen and have an accuracy with the blade that others would kill for.
    With their power of cunning, wide skill set, and nimble bodies, Rogues can be found in many places of society, not just stereotypical thugs and criminals.  In a party Rogues provide high damage in single attacks and keep their comrades from stumbling into traps.

Quick Build

If you are looking to play a Rogue as quickly as possible, consider the following:

  • Dexterity should be your highest Attribute.
  • Intelligence should be your second highest if you plan to be good at Investigation.
  • Presence should be your second highest if you plan to be good at Persuasion and Deception.
  • If you focus on melee fighting take the following equipment:
    • A rapier
    • A shortsword
    • A burglary pack
    • Leather armor, two daggers, and a thievery kit
  • If you focus on ranged fighting take the following equipment:
    • A shortsword
    • A shortbow and quiver of 20 arrows
    • A burglary pack
    • Leather armor, two daggers, and a thievery kit

system.classDetails:
Class Features at 1st Level

Class Categorization: Martial
Rest Dice: 1d8
Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Mana: None

Proficiencies

Armor: Light
Weapons: Choose three from the following list: blowgun, club, dagger, quarterstaff, sickle, light crossbow, dart, shortbow, sling, slingshot, rapier, shortsword, hand crossbow.
Trades: Thievery
Save Checks: Dexterity, Intelligence
Skills: Choose four from the following list: Acrobatics, Athletics, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Performance, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand, Stealth

Equipment

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • (a) a rapier, or (b) a shortsword
  • (a) a shortbow and quiver of 20 arrows, (b) a hand crossbow and quiver of 20 bolts (c) a shortsword, or (d) two simple melee weapons
  • (a) a burglary pack, (b) a delving pack, or (c) an adventuring pack
  • Leather armor, two daggers, and a thievery kit

Alternate Rule: Instead of taking any equipment from this section, instead take 5d4 x 5gp and spend it on items from the equipment section.
    Anything bought this way cannot be magical, with the exception of magical foci, and no equipment can be modified mechanically from their base state.

Starter Abilities

You gain all of the following abilities: @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.A3GDM85RSHS80N3U]{Speak in Code}, @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.1P8DJ5ZSPPJRMLWH]{Sneak Attack}

Class Features at Higher Levels

Class Categorization: Martial
Rest Dice Gain After 1st Level: 1d8 per Rogue level
Hit Point Gain After 1st Level:
    -  1d8 + your Constitution modifier
    -  Or 5 + your Constitution modifier
Mana: None

New Ability (Skip for Growth Levels)

Each time you gain a Rogue level, unless it is a Growth Level, gain one ability of your choice from the following list or from any Rogue Sub-Class. If this is the first ability you select from a tier or sub-class then you also recieve its Given Abilities, indicated by the 🆓 symbol. If an ability has requirements listed with it then you must satisfy all of them before you can choose that ability. Likewise, if a sub-class has requirements listed with it then you must also satisfy them in order to choose any abilities from that sub-class, in addition to any requirements the chosen ability may have.

Novice Abilities

Unlock: Must have the Rogue Starter Abilities before taking any of these abilities.

Options: @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.JXY8GNKY37UR93L6]{One Step Ahead}, @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.5H1YLH3E742DLXDK]{Multi-Talented}

Adept Abilities

Unlock: When you reach 6th level overall and 3rd level Rogue.

🆓 Given Ability: @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.MK99LKGD8IHJ48QD]{Desperate Quickness}

Options: @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.X90JYLUREXENZDQC]{Evasive}, @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.T4YIHUPQPW9YAAV6]{Exploit}

Rogue Sub-Classes: Roguish Archetype

When you meet the requirements for each sub-class, you can choose from that sub-class’ abilities. Every level taken in a Rogue sub-class counts as a Rogue level.

Roguish Archetypes: @Compendium[undertaking.archetypes-rogue.CI8GLO83XPEZY0HX]{Ninja}
